title: Dev Classes: Topic-wise Quiz App (Teacher creates quizzes, students take tests)

requirements.text: Create the core app structure and navigation for a quiz app named "Dev Classes" with two primary user journeys: (1) teacher creates and manages topic-wise quizzes and questions, and (2) student selects a topic/quiz and takes a test.

quotes: Main ek teacher hu ek quiz app banana chahta hu  taki main topic test le sku mujhe dev classes ke naam se app banana hai

acceptanceCriteria: App title/branding reads "Dev Classes" in the UI.
There are clear entry points to Teacher flow and Student flow (e.g., separate pages or a role-based dashboard).
Navigation is functional and does not dead-end (all primary actions lead to a screen).

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity login and a simple role model (Teacher vs Student) so the same app can support quiz creation (teacher-only) and quiz taking (student).

quotes: Main ek teacher hu ek quiz app banana chahta hu  taki main topic test le sku

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in and sign out using Internet Identity.
A user can be designated as Teacher or Student (initially via a simple in-app admin/teacher claim flow).
Teacher-only screens/actions are blocked for Students (UI + backend enforcement).

requirements.text: Backend: Add persistent data models and CRUD APIs to support topic-wise quizzes: Topics, Quizzes (linked to a Topic), Questions (linked to a Quiz), and multiple-choice options with a correct answer.
acceptanceCriteria: APIs exist to create/list/update/delete Topics, Quizzes, and Questions.
A Quiz can be listed by Topic and loaded with its Questions.
Only Teachers can create/update/delete Topics/Quizzes/Questions.

requirements.text: Teacher UI: Provide screens to create and manage Topics, create Quizzes under a Topic, and add/edit/remove multiple-choice Questions (with 2â€“6 options and a single correct option).

quotes: taki main topic test le sku

acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can create a Topic, then create a Quiz under that Topic, then add Questions to that Quiz.
Teacher can edit and delete Topics/Quizzes/Questions from the UI.
Validation prevents saving a question without text, without options, or without exactly one correct option.

requirements.text: Student UI: Provide a flow to browse Topics and Quizzes, take a quiz question-by-question or as a single form, submit answers, and view the result (score and basic review of correct vs chosen answers).
acceptanceCriteria: Student can select a Topic and then a Quiz to start.
Student can submit a completed quiz and receive a computed score.
Result view shows total questions, correct count, and per-question correctness feedback.

requirements.text: Backend: Store quiz attempts/results per student (by principal) for each quiz, and expose APIs for (a) a student to view their own past attempts and (b) a teacher to view aggregated results per quiz (e.g., list of attempts).
acceptanceCriteria: After submission, an Attempt record is persisted containing quizId, student principal, timestamp, answers, and score.
Student can list only their own attempts.
Teacher can list attempts for quizzes they manage (or all quizzes if teacher is global).

requirements.text: Frontend: Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme for "Dev Classes" and apply it consistently across pages (typography, spacing, buttons, cards, and form styles). Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.

quotes: mujhe dev classes ke naam se app banana hai

acceptanceCriteria: All primary pages share a consistent layout and component styling.
Primary UI palette is not blue/purple-dominant.
App feels like a unified product (no mismatched default styles).

requirements.text: Add the required generated static images into the app and use them in the UI (e.g., header/landing area) by serving them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image routing).

quotes: mujhe dev classes ke naam se app banana hai

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
Images render correctly in the UI without fetching through the backend.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing UI text.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add migration code if an upgrade requires it.
Do not edit files under frontend paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose UI using provided components instead.
nonGoals: Timed exams, proctoring, or anti-cheating features.
Question types beyond multiple-choice (e.g., essays, coding questions).
Third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.

required: Minimal modern wordmark logo reading "Dev Classes" on transparent background (dev-classes-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Warm, classroom-inspired abstract header background with subtle educational motifs (dev-classes-hero-bg.dim_1600x600.png)

goalsToAdd: Build a quiz app named "Dev Classes" for topic-wise tests where a teacher creates questions and students take quizzes.
